A MOvE to stop Mr. Gaitskell from nominating any more Labour life Peers is to be made at a meeting of Labour M Ps tomo row. Mr. Michael Foot has put down a resolution on the subject and he is to be backed by Mr. Will Griffiths, M P for Manchester Exchange.

Though they may gather some Left-wing support, a large majority of Labour M Ps are likely to turn down the Foot-Griffiths resolution. Mr. Foot's line will be that as they should not now put forward nominees. He believes that the House of Lords should be abolished and that Labour should not take any steps which would appear to"prop up an out-dated institution.

A MOvE to stop Mr. Gaitskell from nominating any more Labour life Peers is to be made at a meeting of Labour OM Ps tomorrow. Mr. Michael Foot has put down a resolution on the subject and he is to be backed by Mr. Will Griffiths, OM P for Manchester Exchange.
